page.title: 17Heybridge Swifts
page.content: Heybridge Swifts Football Club were formed originally in 1882.For a great majority of that time they played on land owned by{Bentalls.}However in 1965 the family firm was taken over by a large company called Acrow.They announced intentions to build on the land and intimated to the Swifts that they had to find other playing facilities.Land was purchased in Scraley Road at the cost of Â£750. A clubhouse , changing rooms and more recently, in 1982, floodlights ,have been added to make the ground one of the best in the county. On the playing side,black and white stripes have been seen on Saturdays in Heybridge for over 100 years and the recent acceptance into the Isthmian league should mean that the Swifts should be an important part of Heybridge life for years to come.
